item.title: This Week at Remap
item.content:encoded:
It's funny. This is the kind of week where it would be very easy to find myself sipping on a beer each night before bed, scrolling through hype videos about the upcoming Chicago Bears playoff game. Instead, I gotta work off some of my overindulging over the holidays with daily treadmill runs. I usually run in the morning, but maybe I should start running at night and swap an IPA for burning a couple hundred calories? I mean, it'll make the IPA taste better this weekend. Literally as I'm typing this out, StubHub sent me a notification informing me Bears tickets are available for the game this weekend, but thankfully, a family party in the early afternoon will prevent me from making a poor financial choice and trying to attend said game. If they win and play at home again? Stop it.

-pk, who is already laying out reasons for this year's Bears season to be a success no matter what happens, preemptively guarding his heart

  • PODCAST: Sports! – I promise we'll do an emergency pod about next week's game, regardless of outcome, but I don't know that we'll do a full Sports! pod. It's a lot of football and, in theory, this publication should do other things, too. (I have a podcast idea I'm hoping to start rolling out in February? Stay tuned.)
  • STREAM: Steam Vent – It's been a minute since Chia and I went scrolling down Steam's new releases category looking for gems. Time to dive back in.
  • STREAM: RV There Yet? – I guess we're not done with this? For some reasons that will be disclosed on a later HOA, this might shift days and/or become something else, depending on Rob's schedule. Second stream will still happen.
  • PODCAST: Remap Radio – The final "normal" Remap Radio podcast for a minute, before we switch over to our Game of the Year podcast recordings. Someone's homework assignment may or may not have done a number on me.
  • ARTICLE: Letter Series – Topic to be determined.

Patrick Klepek (he/him) is an editor at Remap. In another life, he worked on horror movie sets, but instead, he also runs Crossplay, a newsletter about parenting and video games. You can follow him on Twitter, Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
